alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 15 at 9:11PM CST until February 15 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST FOR NORTH CENTRAL LAFAYETTE AND SOUTHERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 911 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Laws Hill, or 10 miles southwest of Wall Doxey State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Wall Doxey State Park, Harmontown, Laws Hill, Potts Camp, Malone, Blackwater, Waterford, Higdon, Gilton, Chulahoma, Lake Center, Galena, Spraggins and Waites. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
